newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Coles Q3 sales up 6.5 pct to A$4.559 bln.
newsitem.headline: Coles Q3 sales up 6.5 pct to A$4.559 bln.

text.p: Australia's largest retailer Coles Myer Ltd said on Thursday that sales for the third quarter had risen 6.5 percent to A$4.559 billion.
Coles said sales for the nine months ending April 27 totalled A$14.50 billion, up 5.7 percent on the previous corresponding period.

The food and liquor group, comprising Coles, Bi-Lo, Liquorland and Red Rooster, increased sales by 12.3 percent over the same quarter last year with the company saying supermarkets continued to perform well, posting their tenth consecutive quarter of double-digit sales growth.
Coles said sales in general merchandise group, made up of K-Mart, Officeworks and World 4 Kids, were 5.8 percent higher than the same period lat year.
However in the apparel group, comprising Target, Katies and Fosseys, sales were marginally lower, down 1.1 percent compared to the same period last year.
Coles cited the general state of the apparel market, the inetgration of Fosseys and a poor Katies result as reasons for the softer sales result.
By 11.25 a.m. (0125 GMT), Coles shares were four cents lower at A$6.40 on turnover of 448,888 shares.
